--- layout: external title: Privacy Policy ---


This policy describes how jkdev (collectively, "we", "I", "us", "our", "my", "mine", "jkdev") uses your data.
Under the keyword "information" or "data" I mean any data that can identify you specificly.

This policy is effective as of the date of its creation.
This policy may change from time to time.
We will post any changes to this policy on this page.

If you are a child and/or do not understand the contents of this page, please ask your parent or legal guardian to read and explain this page to you!

⠀

Principles:

We comply with data protection law and regulations in the European Union and the UK.
That means that your data will be:

  • • Used fairly and in a transparent way.
  • • Collected only for valid purposes that we have explained to you and not used in any way not written on this page.
  • • Relevant to the purposes explained on this page.
  • • Accurate and kept up to date.
  • • Stored securely.

⠀

What kind of information we collect:

We may collect, store and use the following categories of personal data about you:

  • • Any data provided in a contact form, event application form, or other sign-up form, including your name, title, telephone number, email address, online aliases and video game usernames. (We rarely but sometimes require passwords for any of your accounts.)
  • • Any data collected in association with you participation in an event or/and a promotion run by us, including your UUID*, IP address and Discord User ID.
  • • Information about you in any marketing or other video that features your image, voice or/and you as a character within a game.
  • • Other contact details.

⠀

How is your information collected?

We may collect data from the following sources:

  • • We may collect your data when you sign-up or/and participate in any event run on our digital platform.
  • • We may collect your personal data from Minecraft servers, for example, we may collect your Minecraft Username when you connect (join) any of our Minecraft Servers.
  • • We may also collect your personal data through other platforms like YouTube, Instagram, Twitch, Twitter, Discord and TikTok. For example when you tag us and/or mention us in your posts, statuses and comments on our profiles, during participation on these platforms, when you upload videos based on our content that feature your inage, your voice and/or you as a character in a video game on a third party platform and when you provide us with your personal data on our accounts on these platforms.
  • • We may collect your data through other people who may, for example, mention you on our social media accounts or the messages they send to us.
  • • We also may collect your data using third party tracking technologies and cookies on our websites.

We may recieve information about you from you and/or individuals you work with within the scope of our relationship with the organisation you are engaged by, for example, if you work for an event partner or other organisation we have a relationship with.

⠀

How we will use your personal data:

We will collect your data for the following purposes and lawful bases:

  • • To administer your registration and/or participation in our events.
  • • Keep records related to support enquiries, servers or events.
  • • To produce and/or circulate videos in which your image, voice and/or you are featured as a character in a game, or to otherwise share information about you on a leaderboard.
  • • To deliver marketing material to you, on the basis of your consent.
  • • To deliver materials to you (sometimes via email).
  • • To request information gfrom you that we need to collect under legal requirements, when this is nessecary to comply with legal requirements.
  • • To repond to messages from you, for example, on discord. This will be done on the basis of your consent (if you register and/or message us and when it is appropriate for us to reply, we will proceed on the basis that you consent to us using your personal data to the extent required to respond to you).
  • • To administer and protect our services, including debugging*, system testing and data analysis, on the interest of running our services

⠀

Who we share your personal data with:

These are the circustances under which we might share your personal data with third parties:

  • • Service Providers: We share personal data collected by us with service providers we use to help us operate our technical infrastructure, such as web hosting providers (IT-Media-Hof and Cloudflare), cloud server providers (Oracle OCI), Minecraft Related Services (Crafthead) and web infrastructure and security services (Cloudflare)
  • • Events, services and other partners: Your personal data might be shared with third party organisations as part of our relationship with then, for example, when such organisations are involved in the operation of our events and/or services. We ask for your consent when such organisations want to send you marketing communications.
  • • Social Media and other platforms: Your personal data may be shared with other parties and/or on our social media accounts for the purposes and the legitimate interest of facilitating our operations and promoting out services and/or events and your profie (where applicable).
  • • Austrian Tax Office and law enforcement agencies: We may also disclose your personal data to the Austrian tax office and/or law enforcement agencies in order to assist with any investigations, when we bring a claim or defend ourselves against a claim that requires the disclosure of the personal data, and when we engage professional advisors
  • • Other data sharing: There are other circumstances in which we may need to share your data with third parties. For example, in connection with legal proceedings or if we need to protect or defend our legal rights.
We will always only share your personal data in other circumstances where it is lawful to do so.

⠀

Data retention

We may retain your information for a period of up to 3 years for purpose of bringing and/or defending our interests in legal claims. After this period, we may securely delete your information.

⠀

Your rights

Under circumstances, by law you have the right to:

  • • Request access to your personal data.
  • • Request correction of your personal data.
  • • Request erasure of your personal data.
  • • Request restriction of processing of your personal data.
  • • Request transfer of your personal data.
  • • Object to processing of your personal data.
  • • Withdraw consent to processing of your personal data.

If you want to review, verify, correct or request erasure of your personal data, object to the processing of your personal data, or request that we transfer a copy of your personal data to another party, please contact us over on our Discord server: [Button]

Once we have recieved your request, we will no longer process your data, and subject to our retention policy, we will securely delete your information.

⠀

International Data Transfer

We may share your personal data with organisations that process data in and/or are incorporated in territories outside of the UK and/or EEA and which do not provide the same level of protection to personal data as countries subject to the General Data Protection Regulation ((EU) 2016/679) or other applicable data protection law.
Where necessary, appropriate safeguards are implemented for transfers of data, including standard contractual clauses approved by the European Commission which can be found at: https://ec.europa.eu/info/law/law-topic/data-protection/international-dimension-data-protection/standard-contractual-clauses-scc_en and supplementary measures if we deem it necessary in the circumstances, such as further contractual commitments.

⠀
⠀
An UUID is an Unique User ID that is generated by the video game called Minecraft. It is used to identify a player in a game.
Debugging is the technical term for troubleshooting and testing of our computer systems.
